docs.lead_paragraph: Traumatized by childhood incidents, Attis Clopton was deathly afraid of water, so he attacked his phobia by enrolling in a program of swimming lessons.

headline.seo: With Intensive Swim Lessons, a Man Attacks His Fear of Water
headline.main: A New Yorker Faces His Phobia, One Stroke at a Time

docs.abstract: Attis Clopton, Brooklyn man who is one of estimated 19.2 million American adults suffering from a phobia, tackles childhood fear of water by enrolling in swimming lessons; experts say to conquer a phobia, one must confront it; after three weeks of lessons, Clopton overcomes his terror and learns to swim.
docs.snippet: Traumatized by childhood incidents, Attis Clopton was deathly afraid of water, so he attacked his phobia by enrolling in a program of swimming lessons.
